alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 7:18AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE AND WESTERN LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 745 AM EDT... At 717 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Minerva Park, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Gahanna, Pataskala, Johnstown, Sunbury, Minerva Park, Beechwood Trails, Easton, Summit Station, New Albany, Jersey, Galena, Kirkersville, Alexandria, Hartford, Interstate 71 at US Route 36/State Route 37, Alum Creek State Park and State Route 310 at State Route 161. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
